column4: Does anyone know if there's a way to connect to a machine with SSH, use an X app, and then disconnect and leave it running to reconnect later? I'm looking for something like Screen but for GUI X apps.
!screen
most GUI apps allow you to specify the --display to use. normally though you have to be root in order to hijack another display like that (if it even works)
you will, of course, want to run it with nohup
will that work? launching it with &?
i said nohup, not &
it stands for "no hangup", basically if the terminal that started the program gets terminated, the program will still run
cool, that sounds like exactly what I wanted. How would I reconnect then?
what do you mean? you wouldn't. you would not get to actually USE that application unless you were at the computer. you just started it.
well like say if wanted to connect with SSH, start up Azureus, do some stuff, then disconnect and let it run for a few hours, but then reconnect and check on it/start more torrents or something
i would suggest screen and rtorrent for that
I actually am using screen and rtorrent right now. But Azureus offers some features rtorrent doesn't that I really like.
but there are other examples of GUI apps that I'd like to be able to start, leave running, and return to.
perhaps instead try launching azureus inside a screen session so you can connect to the same terminal and have control of the azereus process?
how can you even use them though? you're on a text-only terminal with no X forwarding. all you can do is basically start, stop, or send remote commands if the program allows that
perhaps VNC or RDP would be easier to use? you can use both with an existing X session iirc
you can forward X through SSH. I do it all the time. It works fantastically.
yes, but can you connect to an existing X session through SSH?
I don't know! That's what I'm asking!
which is why i'm recommending RDP or VNC instead
yeah, but then I have to run an X server on the box. If I just forward X, the X server is running on the remote machine.
the client program goes away when the X server goes away. this will not work
fair enough.
